page.title: 15RAINCLIFFE WOODS (CONTINUED)
page.content: Elsewhere valuable species thrive.Oak is confined to heavier soils.Most areas where soil is fresh and moist Ash and Sycamore is most suited. The conifers,Ash and Sycamore will last 80 years.Oak 100-130 years,Beech 90-100 years. Birds, Mammals,Amphibians and Molluscs thrive in this woodland.Checks show that the number of birds has fallen in recent years due to the removal of mature trees.The Mammals still live peacefully in the woods not yet disturbed by humans.The Mere is looked after by a fish society and contains many species of fish. e.g.Pike,Roach,Perch and Rudd. The whole wood costs the counsil Â£27,000 to maintain.
